title: Zion National Park: Current Conditions
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Current Conditions              Current Conditions          Alerts    No alerts at this time             Zion National Park is Open Zion National Park is open all year. Facility hours and the shuttle schedule change throughout the year.         Shuttle System   The Zion Canyon Scenic Drive is accessible by shuttle bus only through October 25 and on weekends in November. Shuttle Schedule           Weather Conditions   In summer, temperatures in Zion National Park often exceed 100°F/38°C. Zion experiences monsoons from mid-July into September that results in an increased risk of flash floods. Always be aware of the threat of storms and lightning and be prepared for a wide range of weather conditions. Check the weather forecast and know what to expect on the Weather and Climate page, or find out what it looks like now on the park webcam.          River Conditions Flow Rate of the Virgin River  The Narrows closes when the flow rate is over 150 cubic feet per second (CFS), or during spring snowmelt. The Narrows also closes when a Flash Flood Warning is issued by the National Weather Service, and remains closed for two hours after the warning is lifted. Check the weather before you head into a narrow canyon. Flash floods are always possible.          Latest News Visit the News Release page for up-to-date park news. Connect with Zion through our social media sites on Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, and Flickr.         Trail Conditions  All trails are open at this time, with the exception of Hidden Canyon - Closed from June 6 through September 1, 2016 for trail repair.          Road Conditions From November to May, road conditions in the park will be updated here. In addition to this page, you can also find updated road conditions on Twitter. For Utah road conditions, call 866-511-8824, or if you are in Utah, dial  5-1-1 on your cell phone.        Zion Canyon Scenic Drive: The Zion Canyon Scenic Drive is accessible by shuttle bus only from March 12 through late November.    Zion-Mt. Carmel Highway: Open.    Kolob Canyons Road: Open. In winter, the Kolob Canyons Road closes frequently during inclement weather.   Kolob Terrace Road: Open, dry. The Lava Point Road is open and passable for 2-wheel drive vehicles. The West Rim Road is now open; high clearance vehicles recommended.
